intro: Eriocoma, commonly known as the woolly thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their dense, white, woolly coating on the stems and leaves, which gives them a distinctive appearance. They are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in rocky or sandy soils. Eriocoma species often have small, spiny leaves and produce yellow or purple flowers. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
